Abstract: More than 1,700 New Yorkers pay $500 to $1,500 a head to attend New Year's Eve party at Rose Center for Earth and Space of American Museum of Natural History, which encloses the rebuilt Hayden Planetarium, and have a preview of sky show presented by new $3.5 million Zeiss star projector; photo (M)
Snippet: More than 1,700 New Yorkers pay $500 to $1,500 a head to attend New Year's Eve party at Rose Center for Earth and Space of American Museum of Natural History, which encloses the rebuilt Hayden Planetarium, and have a preview of sky show presented ...
LeadParagraph: It was, at very long last, the night to party until it wasn't 1999. And then? It was time to party some more.

Headline.Main: At Planetarium, the Fanciest Ball Is Inside the Cosmic One
Headline.PrintHeadline: 1/1/00: A CITY CELEBRATES; At Planetarium, the Fanciest Ball Is Inside the Cosmic One

Keywords.Name: organizations
Keywords.Value: Rose Center for Earth and Space
